438
May 23d 4
Dr I M. Risk.
Collensville: Ky
Sir

Your letter of the 20th inst to his Excellency Gov Bramlette has been referred to this office for reply. I inclose herein authority to recruit, and when your men are mustered in you will get a commission to rank according to the number so mustered. As the time is short it will require immediate action in order to meet with success. The state agent at the nearest post of rendezvous can supply you with necessary blanks and information.

Very Respectfully
John Boyle
Adjt Genl Ky
